title: Untitled
suggestion:
VERSE: 1 Corinthians 6:18
TEXT: Flee fornication. Every sin that a man doeth is without the body; but he that committeth fornication sinneth against his own body.
MEANING: This verse provides guidance on dealing with lust by advising to flee from it. It acknowledges that lust can manifest as a desire for physical intimacy outside of a committed relationship, which is considered a sin against one's own body. By fleeing from lust, one can break free from its hold and work towards spiritual growth and purity.

title: Untitled
suggestion:
VERSE: Ephesians 4:26-27
TEXT: Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your wrath:
MEANING: This verse directly relates to the user's struggle with rage, offering a message of caution and guidance. It suggests that it's okay to feel anger, but we must not let it consume us or lead to destructive behavior. By acknowledging and managing our anger, we can avoid sinning and maintain a sense of peace and control.

title: Untitled
suggestion:
VERSE: Ephesians 4:26
TEXT: "Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your wrath:"
MEANING: This verse provides guidance in managing the anger and rage the writer is experiencing. It acknowledges that it's normal to feel angry, but it's how we choose to express and deal with that anger that matters. By not letting the sun set on their wrath, the writer is encouraged to address and resolve their emotions in a healthy and constructive way before the end of the day.

title: Untitled
content: How do I keep going o lord
suggestion:
VERSE: 2 Corinthians 4:16
TEXT: For which cause we faint not; but though our outward man perish, yet the inward man is renewed day by day.
MEANING: This verse speaks directly to perseverance in the midst of struggles, as the writer of the journal entry is seeking guidance on continuing forward. The verse reminds us that even when our circumstances may seem to be deteriorating (our "outward man perish"), our inner strength and faith can be renewed daily, giving us the courage to keep going.

title: Untitled
content: Hi I would like to know how to fast
suggestion:
VERSE: Psalm 35:13
TEXT: "But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth: I prayed with head bowed upon my chest."
MEANING: This verse relates to fasting as it describes a person's spiritual response to physical affliction. They prayed with a bowed head and sackcloth, signifying a deep sense of humility, mourning, and reverence. Fasting can be a means to connect with the divine in times of physical or spiritual need, just like described in this verse.
